semantics.label: Tutorial and Examples: Papi Jo's Drupal test site
Score explanation text
semantics.default: Correct answers give +1 point. Incorrect answers give -1 point. The lowest possible score is 0.

semantics.label: Score explanation text for drop zones with a fixed quantity
semantics.default: Correctly filled drop zones have a green border and give 1 point. Incorrectly filled drop zones have a red border.

fields.label: The title of this question
fields.description: Used in summaries, statistics etc.

fields.label: Show Title
fields.description: Uncheck this option if you do not want this title to be displayed. The title will only be displayed in summaries, statistics etc.

fields.label: Background image
fields.description: Optional. Select an image to use as background for your drag and drop task.

fields.label: Task Background color
fields.description: The color of the task background (if no image)

fields.label: Task size
fields.description: Specify how large (in px) the play area should be.

fields.label: Task
fields.description:
Start by placing your drop zones.
Next, place your droppable elements and check off the appropriate drop zones.
Last, edit your drop zone again and check off the correct answers.
Choose the type of content you would like to add.

fields.label: Infinite number of element instances
fields.description: Clones this element so that it can be dragged to multiple drop zones.

fields.label: Value
fields.description: Please set a value for this draggable element. Negative values accepted.

fields.label: Background Opacity
fields.description: The background opacity of this dropzone

fields.label: Border color
fields.description: The border color of this dropzone (when highlighted)

fields.label: Message displayed on correct match
fields.description: Message will appear below the task on "check" if correct droppable is matched.

fields.label: Message displayed on incorrect match
fields.description: Message will appear below the task on "check" if the match is incorrect.

fields.label: Message displayed on incorrect number
fields.description: Message will appear below the task on "check" if drop zone contains an incorrect number of items. You can use the variables @requirednumber and @selectednumber in your message, for example "Sorry, you selected @selectednumber items, that's not correct. You should have selected @requirednumber"

fields.label: Message displayed on incorrect total value
fields.description: Message will appear below the task on "check" if drop zone contains an incorrect total value. You can use the variables @requiredvalue and @totalvalue in your message, for example "Sorry, the items you selected make up a total value of @totalvalue; they should add up to @requiredvalue". You can also use the variables @oppositerequiredvalue and @oppositetotalvalue is needed.

fields.label: This drop zone can only contain one element
fields.description: Make sure there is only one correct answer for this dropzone

fields.label: How many elements MUST this drop zone contain?
fields.description: Exact number of draggables expected in this drop zone

fields.label: Total draggables value
fields.description: Enter the expected total value of the draggables dropped in this zone

fields.label: Enable Auto-Align
fields.description: Will auto-align all draggables dropped in this zone.

fields.label: Define custom feedback for any score range
fields.description: Click the "Add range" button to add as many ranges as you need. Example: 0-20% Bad score, 21-91% Average Score, 91-100% Great Score!

semantics.label: Behavioural settings
semantics.description: These options will let you control how the task behaves.

fields.label: Enable draggables dropped Quantity in drop Zones AND draggables value
fields.description: Check this option to display an 'Exact number of draggables expected' field in each drop zone  AND draggables value.

fields.label: Require user input before the solution can be viewed
Remove all 'correct' and 'wrong' styles on the draggables when all is correct.
fields.description: Removing all 'correct' and 'wrong' styles may be useful e.g. when displaying a completed jigsaw puzzle activity.

fields.label: Give one point for the whole task
fields.description: Disable to give one point for each draggable that is placed correctly.

fields.label: Apply penalties
fields.description: Apply penalties for elements dropped in the wrong drop zones. This must be enabled when the same element(s) are able to be dropped into multiple drop zones, or if there is only one drop-zone. If this is not enabled, learners may match all items to all drop-zones and always receive a full score.

fields.label: Enable score explanation
fields.description: Display a score explanation to user when checking their answers (if the 'Apply penalties' option has been selected).

fields.label: Enable score explanation for Quantity
fields.description: Display a score explanation to user when checking their answers.

fields.label: Keep correct answers
fields.description: Check this option if you want to keep the draggable elements dropped in the correct drop zones after pressing 'Retry'.

fields.label: Disable completed Drop Zones
fields.description: Check this option if you want to make it impossible to drag draggables into or out of correctly completed Drop Zones.

fields.label: Randomize the position of the draggable elements
fields.description: Check this option if you want to randomize the position of the draggable elements (except for the multiple draggables).

fields.label: Reset the position of a dropped draggable element.
fields.description: Check this option if you want to reset the position of a dropped draggable element when dropping a new one onto the drop zone (only works in drop zones which can only contain a single element).

fields.label: Background opacity for draggables
fields.description: If this field is set, it will override opacity set on all draggable elements. This should be a number between 0 and 100, where 0 means full transparency and 100 means no transparency

fields.label: Background opacity for drop zones
fields.description: If this field is set, it will override opacity set on all dropzones. This should be a number between 0 and 100, where 0 means full transparency and 100 means no transparency

fields.label: Drop Zones Background color
fields.description: The background color of the Drop Zones. Default value is rgb(245, 245, 245)

fields.label: Border color for drop zones
fields.description: If this color is set, it will override the color of the individual dropzones borders. To UNSET this override color, select the first palette setting, rgba(0,0,0,0,).

fields.label: Drop Zone Highlighting
fields.description: Choose when to highlight drop zones.

fields.label: Enable FullScreen
fields.description: Check this option to enable the full screen button.

fields.label: Show score points
fields.description: Show points earned for each answer. Not available when the 'Give one point for the whole task' option is enabled.

fields.label: Display correct/wrong and scorepoints horizontally
fields.description: Check this option to display the correct/wrong ticks and the score points horizontally (inline) instead of the default vertical display.

semantics.label: Header for panel containing feedback for correct/incorrect answers
Textual representation of the score bar for those using a readspeaker
Textual representation of the score explanation button
Description for Display Solution
semantics.default: Task is updated to contain the solution.
semantics.description: This text tells the user that the task has been updated with the solution.

semantics.label: Text for "Requires answer" message
semantics.default: Please answer before viewing the solution
